gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GTC CTD up casts along the US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect from the R/V Thomas G. Thompson TN303 cruise in the tropical Pacific from Peru to Tahiti during 2013 (U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project)

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Cite this dataset as: Moffett, James, Cutter, Gregory and German, Christopher (2014) GTC CTD up casts along the US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect from the R/V Thomas G. Thompson TN303 cruise in the tropical Pacific from Peru to Tahiti during 2013 (U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project). Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO). Dataset version 2014-10-30 [if applicable, indicate subset used]. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset/522658 [access date]

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: CTD - GT-C UpCasts Dataset Description: <p>CTD - GT-C&nbsp; UpCasts 20141030ODU</p><p><br />SMDEPTH IS SAUNDERS-MANTYLA DEPTH (INTEGRATED; USES DYNAMIC HEIGHT)<br />FMDEPTH IS FOFONOFF-MILLARD DEPTH (NON-INTEGRATED; ALSO USED BY SBE)</p><p><strong>Data are currently RESTRICTED.<br />Contact Chief Sci/PI for access.</strong></p><p><strong>srg/19Aug2014</strong></p> Acquisition Description: <p>From the TN303 cruise report:<br />Two types of rosette/SBE9plus CTD casts (ODF/30L-Niskin and GT-C/12L-GoFlo) were made at 36 station locations during U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT.</p><p>Shipboard CTD data processing was performed automatically at the end of each deployment using&nbsp;SIO/STS CTD processing software v.5.1.6-1. Raw GT-C CTD data and bottle trip files, acquired by SBE&nbsp;Seasave V 7.17a on a Windows XP workstation, were also imported into the Linux processing system,&nbsp;providing a backup of the raw data.</p><p>At the end of the cruise, all GT-C CTD&nbsp;data were updated in the database using the post-cast Seasave-processed&nbsp;".btl" file 5-second averaged CTD data, in order to include processed CTD Oxygen values.&nbsp;The 5-second average used resulted in slightly better agreement between CTD and GoFlo salinity values&nbsp;than the shorter 3-second average used for the Niskin rosette.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1235248 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1235248&HistoricalAwards=false
Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1130870 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1130870&HistoricalAwards=false

Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PRESPR01/ Name: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/TEMPP901/ Name: Temperature (ITS-90) of the water body Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/CPHLPM01/ Name: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ELTMZZZZ/ Name: Elapsed time Description: The amount of time passed between two marked events. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD Dataset Identifier; General Description: dataset_id: a unique combination of alpha and/or numeric characters designating a dataset (filename in many cases)

PI-supplied Description: expedition code assigned by the CCHDO: NODCShipCodeYearMonthDay; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: cruise section identification number; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Event Number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.
PI-supplied Description: Station Number; General Description: consecutive station number
PI-supplied Description: Cast Number; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Station Date (GMT); General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Station Time (GMT); General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Station Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Station Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Multibeam bottom depth of the cast; General Description: water depth, in meters
PI-supplied Description: Instrument Id (from CTD profile data headers); General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD Pressure; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: CTD pressure quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: CTD Temperature; ITS-90; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

PI-supplied Description: CTD temperature quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD Salinity; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

PI-supplied Description: CTD salinity quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: CTD Oxygen; General Description: dissolved oxygen; e.g. measurement from a high resolution CTD instrument

PI-supplied Description: CTD oxygen quality flag(see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Light Transmission (0-5VDC); General Description: light transmission, as volts

PI-supplied Description: Light Transmission quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Fluorescence (0-5VDC); General Description: fluorescence; indirect measure of pigment concentration; possibly calibrated against extracted pigment concentrations; units may vary with dataset; for US JGOFS fluorescence as measured from CTD instrument sensor NERC Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied.

PI-supplied Description: Fluorescence quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Turbidity (0-5VDC); General Description: turbidity, in volts (scatterometer)

PI-supplied Description: Turbidity quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: SMDEPTH IS SAUNDERS-MANTYLA DEPTH (INTEGRATED; USES DYNAMIC HEIGHT); General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: SMDepth quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: FMDEPTH IS FOFONOFF-MILLARD DEPTH (NON-INTEGRATED; ALSO USED BY SBE); General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: FMDepth quality flag (see WOCE Hydrographic Program Quality Flags); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: CTD Number of Observations; General Description: number of observations

PI-supplied Description: CTD Elapsed Time; General Description: Elapsed time. Typically found in CTD profile data. Units can be seconds, minutes, etc. NERC Description: The amount of time passed between two marked events.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time (ISO formatted); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>From the TN303 cruise report:<br />Two types of rosette/SBE9plus CTD casts (ODF/30L-Niskin and GT-C/12L-GoFlo) were made at 36 station locations during U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT.</p><p>Shipboard CTD data processing was performed automatically at the end of each deployment using&nbsp;SIO/STS CTD processing software v.5.1.6-1. Raw GT-C CTD data and bottle trip files, acquired by SBE&nbsp;Seasave V 7.17a on a Windows XP workstation, were also imported into the Linux processing system,&nbsp;providing a backup of the raw data.</p><p>At the end of the cruise, all GT-C CTD&nbsp;data were updated in the database using the post-cast Seasave-processed&nbsp;".btl" file 5-second averaged CTD data, in order to include processed CTD Oxygen values.&nbsp;The 5-second average used resulted in slightly better agreement between CTD and GoFlo salinity values&nbsp;than the shorter 3-second average used for the Niskin rosette.</p>

<p><strong>Processing notes from README provided by ODF:</strong><br />The CTD depths in the shipboard version (20 Dec 2013) of the data - bottle data in particular - were originally calculated incorrectly due to two software errors. &nbsp;A small error in the gravity calculation affected both bottle and CTD data. In addition, the bottle file CTDDEPTH calculation was inadvertently using a combination of latitude and longitude, vs just latitude, as input to the gravity component of the depth equation, causing up to a 20m error in some of the casts.</p><p>Two different depth calculations were subsequently added into these data files: the original, integrated Saunders-Mantyla integrated depth calculations (SMDEPTH), with the gravity error corrected; and the non-integrated Fofonoff-Millard depth calculations (FMDEPTH), same as those used by SBE. The Fofonoff-Millard depths are used for the primary CTDDEPTH column in both bottle data files.</p><p>ODF reports that the&nbsp;CTDDEPTH column agreed best with depths identified from CTD bottle trips recorded during GEOTRACES CTD acquisition.&nbsp;The depth values in CTDDEPTH column are from the Saunders &amp; Fofonoff 1976 calculation of depth from pressure. This is the same default calculation of depth used by SeaBird (SBE) software. GEOTRACES CTD data acquisition uses SBE software.&nbsp;<strong>It follows that it would be preferable and consistent for GEOTRACES and ODF to use the values in the CTDDEPTH column.</strong></p><p><strong>Processing notes from README_1410.txt:</strong><br />Separate columns of S-M and F-M depths ("SMDEPTH" and "FMDEPTH") are included in bottle and CTD files. In addition, "ODF_CTDPRS" is an added column in the bottle files. This may differ from the main CTDPRS in the bottle file only for EPZT GT-C casts, where Seasave-processed CTD trip data were used.</p><p><strong>Note:</strong>&nbsp;'FLAG_W' columns = WHP (<a href="http://woce.nodc.noaa.gov/woce_v3/wocedata_1/whp/exchange/exchange_format_desc.htm" target="_blank">WOCE Hydrographic Program</a>) quality flags.&nbsp;ODF used the WHP quality coding schema, but also included two non-standard quality codes in the GT-C bottle file:<br />- QUALITY CODE 'A' WAS USED FOR DATA VALUES SUBMITTED AS 'ABOVE DETECTION LIMITS'<br />- QUALITY CODE 'B' WAS USED FOR DATA VALUES SUBMITTED AS 'BELOW DETECTION LIMITS'<br />This was at the request of two different PIs.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird SBE 911plus Instrument Short Name:CTD SBE 911plus Instrument Description: The Sea-Bird SBE 911plus is a type of CTD instrument package for continuous measurement of conductivity, temperature and pressure. The SBE 911plus includes the SBE 9plus Underwater Unit and the SBE 11plus Deck Unit (for real-time readout using conductive wire) for deployment from a vessel. The combination of the SBE 9plus and SBE 11plus is called a SBE 911plus. The SBE 9plus uses Sea-Bird's standard modular temperature and conductivity sensors (SBE 3plus and SBE 4). The SBE 9plus CTD can be configured with up to eight auxiliary sensors to measure other parameters including dissolved oxygen, pH, turbidity, fluorescence, light (PAR), light transmission, etc.). more information from Sea-Bird Electronics Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0058/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
